alert.note: Alert for Rapid City (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued March 17 at 2:06AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Air Pollution Alert for Dust for Rapid City west of the gap in effect from 11 AM this morning to 6 PM MDT this evening... The following message is transmitted in collaboration with the South Dakota Department of Agriculture and Natural Resources. * WHAT...Northwesterly winds 20 to 35 mph with gusts to 45 mph. * WHERE...West of the Gap in Rapid City. * WHEN...11 AM to 6 PM MDT today. IMPACTS...The gusty winds will suspend fine dust in the air and produce poor air quality. Hourly dust concentrations are available on the danr web page http://danr.sd.gov/Environment/AirQuality/AirMonitoring/ RealTimeData.aspx
info.instruction: The Rapid City Air Quality Office recommends the elderly, young, and anyone with respiratory problems avoid excessive physical exertion and exposure to the outside air. Voluntary actions to reduce dust pollution include, ceasing or reducing the manipulation of soil in construction, industrial, and agricultural activities, and increasing the use of pollution controls for soil stabilization, waste pits, stock piles, and construction sites.
